net.myorb.testing

Class SqrtSeries

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.myorb.testing.SqrtSeries

  • public class SqrtSeries
extends java.lang.Object
    experiments with the Taylor polynomial series and other algorithms used for SQRT computation.
    Author:
    Michael Druckman

    • Method Detail

      • errorTermination

        public static void errorTermination(java.lang.String message)
        common method for handling errors, commonly RuntimeException
        Parameters:
        message - text of message for cause of error

      • reduceDomain

        public static double reduceDomain(double x)
        use multiples of perfect squares to transform X to optimal range
        Parameters:
        x - value of X being transformed restricted to 0 < X < 1
        Returns:
        transformer for X such that 0.9 < X*divisor^2 < 1.1

      • alterDivisor

        public static double alterDivisor(double x,
                                  double divisor,
                                  double using)
        reduction algorithm attempts to force X into range ABS (X - 1) < 0.1 seeking the benefit of taking the power series terms down to ending with a multiplier of (0.1)^TERMS at worst
        Parameters:
        x - the value of X being reduced for improved convergence of SQRT series
        divisor - compiled product of adjustments up to this point
        using - attempt further adjustment using this
        Returns:
        new divisor having applied this attempt

      • bitLengthApproximatedSqrt

        public static double bitLengthApproximatedSqrt(double x)
        compute value half bit-width in size
        Parameters:
        x - the value seeking SQRT approximation
        Returns:
        computed approximation

      • power2ApproximatedSqrt

        public static double power2ApproximatedSqrt(double x)
        find nearest 2^n to use as approximation
        Parameters:
        x - the value seeking SQRT approximation 0 < X < 1
        Returns:
        computed approximation

      • taylorSqrtSeries

        public static double taylorSqrtSeries(double x)
        evaluate Taylor SQRT series at X
        Parameters:
        x - value of X for series evaluation
        Returns:
        computed result

      • sqrtUsingTaylor

        public static double sqrtUsingTaylor(double x,
                                     double multiplier,
                                     double divisor)
        apply Taylor series to compute SQRT
        Parameters:
        x - the value searching for the root
        multiplier - compensation for using 1/x where x was > 1
        divisor - compensation for domain reduction
        Returns:
        computed result

      • sqrtUsingTaylorReduced

        public static double sqrtUsingTaylorReduced(double x)
        compute multiplier and divisor for domain reduction
        Parameters:
        x - the value of X being transformed for domain reduction
        Returns:
        the final computed SQRT result

      • sqrtUsingTaylor

        public static double sqrtUsingTaylor(double x)
        computation of SQRT using Taylor polynomial series with domain reduction algorithm (above) which build divisors of SQRTs of perfect squares
        Parameters:
        x - parameter to SQRT function
        Returns:
        computed result

      • runApproximationTestsUsingTaylor

        public static void runApproximationTestsUsingTaylor()
        display table of sqrt(x) for 1 < x <= 100 using Taylor series

      • newtonRaphsonSqrtLoop

        public static double newtonRaphsonSqrtLoop(double x,
                                           double value)
        SQRT computation loop
        Parameters:
        x - approximated root
        value - parameter for sqrt computation
        Returns:
        computed result

      • newtonRaphsonSqrt

        public static double newtonRaphsonSqrt(double value)
        use Newton method approximation of sqrt. root approximation is done based on bit length of parameter
        Parameters:
        value - parameter for sqrt computation
        Returns:
        computed result

      • newtonRaphsonRestrictedSqrt

        public static double newtonRaphsonRestrictedSqrt(double value,
                                                 int approximationType)
        use Newton method approximation of sqrt. domain is restricted to 0 < X < 1 allowing use of 1 as approximation
        Parameters:
        value - the value of parameter for sqrt computation
        approximationType - 1=1, 2=2^n
        Returns:
        computed result

      • sqrtUsingNewton

        public static double sqrtUsingNewton(double x,
                                     int approximationType)
        use Newton method sqrt approximation
        Parameters:
        x - parameter for sqrt computation
        approximationType - 0=bit length, 1=1, 2=2^n
        Returns:
        computed result

      • runApproximationTestsUsingNewton

        public static void runApproximationTestsUsingNewton(int approximationType)
        display table of sqrt(x) for 1 < x <= 100 using Newton-Raphson method
        Parameters:
        approximationType - 0=bit length, 1=1, 2=2^n

      • bisectionSqrtMethod

        public static double bisectionSqrtMethod(double x,
                                         double lo,
                                         double hi)
        find root using bisection. domain of X has been reduced and approximated root range has been set
        Parameters:
        x - the reduced value of X for which we seek a root
        lo - the low side of the expected root computation
        hi - the high side of expected root
        Returns:
        the computed root

      • bisectionSqrtMethod

        public static double bisectionSqrtMethod(double x,
                                         double multiplier,
                                         boolean reducedDomain)
        find root using bisection
        Parameters:
        x - the value searching for the root
        multiplier - compensation for using 1/x where x was > 1
        reducedDomain - reduce domain before bisection
        Returns:
        the value of the root found

      • sqrtUsingBisectionMethod

        public static double sqrtUsingBisectionMethod(double x,
                                              boolean reducedDomain)
        standard SQRT domain reduction
        Parameters:
        x - value in search of root
        reducedDomain - reduce domain before bisection
        Returns:
        the computed root

      • runApproximationTestsUsingBisection

        public static void runApproximationTestsUsingBisection(boolean reducedDomain)
        display table of sqrt(x) for 1 < x <= 100 using bisection method
        Parameters:
        reducedDomain - reduce domain before bisection

      • displayApproximationTest

        public static void displayApproximationTest(double x,
                                            double s)
        display output of a computation and collect stats
        Parameters:
        x - the value of the parameter for this computation
        s - the SQRT value computed

      • abs

        public static double abs(double x)
        standard absolute value function
        Parameters:
        x - the value being compared with zero
        Returns:
        same value as parameter for positive values, otherwise negated value

      • runCoefficientTest

        public static void runCoefficientTest()
        compute sqrt(2) using Taylor series. over 40 terms of the series are required to cover all displayed decimal places of accuracy. the ratio of term/term coefficients presents an interesting pattern.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        entry point
        Parameters:
        args - not used
